metadata.Title: CVE-2010-4150 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in the imap_do_open function in the IMAP extension (ext/imap/php_imap.c) in PHP 5.2 before 5.2.15 and 5.3 before 5.3.4 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-4150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

php5-imap - 5.3.5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> imap plugin is in a separate package (php-imap)

criterions.comment: php-imap package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.5-0ubuntu1').
php5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
